actions.recommendation: Try to lose weight, especially around your abdomen to lower your risk of chronic diseases. Aim for a waist circumference of < 94cm and a body fat percentage of 19 or less.

Supplement with vitamin D 5000iu daily to try and increase your level to between 50 to 80. Vitamin D is important for your bones and mood and can lower inflammation and help decrease the risk of certain cancers.

Try to exercise for at least 30 minutes, 5 times per week. Focus on eating an anti inflammatory diet that is rich in colourful vegetables, high quality protein and good fats (avo, nuts, seeds, olive oil etc). Avoid refined carbohydrates (pasta, bread, rice, pastries etc) and sugar.

Raised homocysteine can contribute to arterial damage and blood clots and usually indicates a deficiency of active vitamin B12 or folate. An optimal level would be around 8. I recommend you supplement with 'Phytomulti' that has all the necessary B vitamins as well as many other vitamins and minerals for overall health.

High triglycerides can increase your risk of heart disease. Try to lower them by losing weight, exercising, eating a high fiber diet, avoiding trans fats, eating fatty fish twice a week, avoid sugar and refined carbohydrates. Supplements can help too, such as Omega 3 and curcumin. Recheck levels in 8 weeks.
